reviews.title: Fun Times
text: The course is an older style one, full 72 par, with some challenges, ups and down terrain, fun gaps to shot the driver through and nice scenery. For the cost, you really can't do much better. The clubhouse patio is also decent.

reviews.title: UNREAL
text: Where do I start. I connected Bushwood golf course about a group of people that wanted to book some tee times together on a Saturday. It would be 12 to 20 people in total from different parts of Ontario. We Golf together once a month and we do a poll on which course we will play. Bushwood was at the top with two other courses. So I sent off an email to Bushwood explaining what it is we do and here was there reply to me "Unfortunately, we only run small tournaments and events during the week, not the weekend." CHIT you not. I was not asking them to shut down the course for us or even give us food. Just a bunch of people of different ages that like to golf together.

reviews.title: Horrible management and course
text: Mary the manager never returns phone calls when you call regarding a complaint . I have left a dozen . Can you believe that ?? A dozen voice mails pertaining to an issue and no call back . She clearly doesn’t care except for taking your money for a crappy boring course . Ignorant approach . Her own staff mouth her . What does that say ?? The course is in horrible condition . Long fairway grass leaves every where and swamp every where . Overpriced and run by a tyrant

reviews.title: Good golf, fun times, great value.
text: With a nod and a wink to Caddyshack, this golf course does not take it self too seriously, golf there on a corporate team outing, middle of the day, middle of the week, and while there were people around, it was never so busy that we were pushing the people in front of us, nor were we being pushed by the people behind us, just they way I like to play golf, no pressure.  The club house is rather basic, but the beer on the 19th hole was cold and they patio had a great view, we had a great time, will be returning to golf again.

reviews.title: Bushwood Marshall’s
text: Play at Bushwood this past weekend. The marshalls were great, they kept the players moving. The greens were in great shape. Overall it was a great day. The course was in good shape, and playing their was a lot of fun
Good job Bushwood’s

reviews.title: Good Facility
text: Went to the driving range and the 9 hole executive course over the weekend. Morning was less crowded and with a warm sun on our back and pleasant wind blowing, it was a near perfect day to spend at the Golf Course. The driving range, putting green and the 9 hole executive course was not difficult to maneuver and was ideal for beginners.  The club house was well decorated with memorabilia and gifts were reasonably priced. The bar was sparse and can definitely be improved. A place not far from the city and recommended for golf enthusiasts.

reviews.title: Great Course and Value
text: Love coming hear early in the season. It's close to the city, just minutes off the 407 and the course is tough yet forgiving in most cases.
This course is great for any level from junior to advanced.
I think we should all enjoy this place while it's still around. When I started playing here 20yrs ago it was nothing but farms around it. Now housing is almost all around it.
Looking forward to my naked game here in 2017.

reviews.title: Great little course for learning
text: My kids come here to learn how to golf with me and they are very friendly and accommodating to them.
Some quick par 3/4 holes and a nice driving range too.

reviews.title: Too Many Workers on the Course
text: I found it very distracting with the grass cutters that seemed to follow up for half the course. One was right on the green when we were approaching. It did not make for a good round of golf for my husband and I. The course was not very well indicated. Signs were missing. It was a bit of disappointment. I will not be back.

reviews.title: Son Approved!
text: Brought my 10 year old son to his first golf game on the Executive course today. He played 9 holes with ease. It is a great course for beginners and to bring the family. He's absolute favorite. Easy course to walk or cart.

As well, my husband and I play the Champion 18 hole course many times. It is 6500+ yards. It has many challenging holes and lush greens. Recommend carting it. This is one of my favourite courses. It's approximately one hour from downtown Toronto.
The staff are experienced and helpful.
My husband and I have also eaten lunch in the clubhouse, the wraps are delicious!

reviews.title: Nice mature country course
text: This facility has both an 18 hole, 6520 yd course for all level of players as well as 9 hole Executive course. There is a driving range, practice putting green and a nice old clubhouse with good food. The courses are typically well maintained with lots of mature trees and water hazards. The course record was set by Bubba Watson with a round of 61. Bubba married a local Canadian gal and happened to show up for a round. Mary Evelyn is the owner, seems to be on top of her staff and runs a tight ship-she can be testy if you don't follow all the rules so don't let your game run into the late twilight hours.

reviews.title: Drinks
text: Remember to  bring your own non-alcohol drink. We went there in the long weekend. Finally met the cart girl at 11 holes and all they have is alcohol.

reviews.title: Decent course for the money
text: In this price range I hope to get half decent greens and fairways, which is what you get at Bushwood. The greens aren't overly difficult, but they do have nice slopes to them that make it just challenging enough for a mid-handicapper like me. Overall it's a nice course for this price range. Interesting that Bubba Watson holds the course record.

reviews.title: Not a bad deal but needs maintenance
text: The greens fees are fairly good here and the golf isn't bad, but boy do the staff need to get on the maintenance and learn some manners.
On-course potties aren't normally things of beauty, but the ones on this course are horrific. Enough said.

The most annoying thing was approaching one green we met the maintenance crew. They met us. They kept chatting and hanging out. We kept waiting to hit our shots. When they finally withdrew from the green, it was to a distance of about four feet.
There they sat, sullenly glaring at us while we finished the hole. Sorry to be such a bother, guys. What fun to meet them again a few holes later. Same thing.
There is a fair bit of water on this course and it's got a few challenges, but mostly it's pasture golf.
For the money, you can do a lot better in Uxbridge or Pickering.

reviews.title: An average course. A bit overpriced.
text: Have played the 18 hole course several times over the past 3 years.. Like many courses, rate of play on weekends is very slow. The course and greens were always in decent condition.  Need to be watchful not to get hit on a couple of holes when required to pass in front of tee boxes. Found the green fees a bit high for the quality of the course , but they do offer some good specials.

reviews.title: Inexpensive golfing in a relaxing atmosphere
text: If you want to go folding in a relaxing, noncompetitive environment, this is the place for you.
Don't worry: there'll be no gophers or crazy groundskeepers

reviews.title: Small golf course
text: Not my favourite golf course but decided to try it out.  Small par 3 course with a driving range and a decent sized clubhouse.

reviews.title: Weekly Golf
text: Great location in Markham to golf once weekly.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  Daily specials are delicious.

reviews.title: I'm not a golfer...
text: I'm not a golfer, so I'm not sure if my review will be all that helpful.
Highlights:
- it's a public course
- it's relatively close to Toronto about 35 -40 minutes from downtown core in no traffic
- it's relatively inexpensive course I've have been told
- it has a long and short course for people who don't have the whole day to play .
- the grounds are well maintained
- they have beverage carts that sell beer and candy
Cons:
- there's not a lot of fresh food options
- beer not always so cold on the carts

reviews.title: Great Golf Course
text: Bushwood is a wonderful family run course and reasonably priced.  There is an 18-hole course and a championship course.  Staff are very friendly and accommodating.  Kids are welcome to play anytime.  This is a course we enjoying playing once weekly as part of our Ladies League.  After the game, we usually enjoy a tasty dinner and drinks on the patio or inside the restaurant.
